TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit JpegBitmapEncoder extends System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapEncoder

Docs.summary: Defines an encoder that is used to encode [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_jpegorg](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-jpegorg-md.md)] format images.

remarks.format: ## Remarks [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_jpegorg](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-jpegorg-md.md)] format bitmaps support frame level thumbnails and frame level metadata. They do not support preview, global thumbnails, global metadata, or multiple frames. Encoding does not work in partial trust. See [WPF Partial Trust Security](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md) for information on partial trust. ## XAML Text Usage

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to initialize a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.JpegBitmapEncoder> to encode a new bitmap image.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether a [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_jpegorg](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-jpegorg-md.md)] image should be flipped horizontally during encoding.
Docs.value: if the image is flipped horizontally during encoding; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks ## XAML Text Usage The horizontal flip represents a lossless transformation of the source image and replaces any previous lossless transformation. ## Examples The following example demonstrates how to set the value of the FlipHorizontal property. [!code-cpp[jpegbitmapdecoderencoder#2](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/jpegencoderdecoder/jpegencoderdecoder.cpp#2)] [!code-vb[jpegbitmapdecoderencoder#2](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/JpegEncoderDecoder/JpegEncoderDecoder.vb#2)] [!code-cs[jpegbitmapdecoderencoder#2](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/JpegEncoderDecoder/JpegEncoderDecoder.cs#2)] [!code-cpp[jpegbitmapdecoderencoder#3](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/jpegencoderdecoder/jpegencoderdecoder.cpp#3)] [!code-vb[jpegbitmapdecoderencoder#3](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/JpegEncoderDecoder/JpegEncoderDecoder.vb#3)] [!code-cs[jpegbitmapdecoderencoder#3](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/JpegEncoderDecoder/JpegEncoderDecoder.cs#3)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether a [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_jpegorg](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-jpegorg-md.md)] image should be flipped vertically during encoding.
Docs.value: if the image is flipped vertically during encoding; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The vertical flip represents a lossless transformation of the source image and replaces any previous lossless transformation. ## XAML Text Usage ## Examples The following example demonstrates how to set the value of the FlipVertical property. [!code-cpp[jpegbitmapdecoderencoder#2](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/jpegencoderdecoder/jpegencoderdecoder.cpp#2)] [!code-vb[jpegbitmapdecoderencoder#2](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/JpegEncoderDecoder/JpegEncoderDecoder.vb#2)] [!code-cs[jpegbitmapdecoderencoder#2](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/JpegEncoderDecoder/JpegEncoderDecoder.cs#2)] [!code-cpp[jpegbitmapdecoderencoder#3](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/jpegencoderdecoder/jpegencoderdecoder.cpp#3)] [!code-vb[jpegbitmapdecoderencoder#3](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/JpegEncoderDecoder/JpegEncoderDecoder.vb#3)] [!code-cs[jpegbitmapdecoderencoder#3](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/JpegEncoderDecoder/JpegEncoderDecoder.cs#3)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates the quality level of the resulting [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_jpegorg](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-jpegorg-md.md)] image.
Docs.value: The quality level of the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_jpegorg](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] image. The value range is 1 (lowest quality) to 100 (highest quality) inclusive.

remarks.format: ## Remarks ## XAML Text Usage ## Examples The following example demonstrates how to set the value of the QualityLevel property. [!code-cpp[jpegbitmapdecoderencoder#2](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/jpegencoderdecoder/jpegencoderdecoder.cpp#2)] [!code-vb[jpegbitmapdecoderencoder#2](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/JpegEncoderDecoder/JpegEncoderDecoder.vb#2)] [!code-cs[jpegbitmapdecoderencoder#2](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/JpegEncoderDecoder/JpegEncoderDecoder.cs#2)] [!code-cpp[jpegbitmapdecoderencoder#3](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/jpegencoderdecoder/jpegencoderdecoder.cpp#3)] [!code-vb[jpegbitmapdecoderencoder#3](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/JpegEncoderDecoder/JpegEncoderDecoder.vb#3)] [!code-cs[jpegbitmapdecoderencoder#3](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/JpegEncoderDecoder/JpegEncoderDecoder.cs#3)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that represents the degree to which a [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_jpegorg](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-jpegorg-md.md)] image is rotated.
Docs.value: The degree to which the image is rotated.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Rotation is supported only in 90-degree increments. The rotation represents a lossless transformation of the source image and replaces any previous lossless transformation. ## XAML Text Usage ## Examples The following example demonstrates how to set the value of the Rotation property. [!code-cpp[jpegbitmapdecoderencoder#2](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/jpegencoderdecoder/jpegencoderdecoder.cpp#2)] [!code-vb[jpegbitmapdecoderencoder#2](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/JpegEncoderDecoder/JpegEncoderDecoder.vb#2)] [!code-cs[jpegbitmapdecoderencoder#2](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/JpegEncoderDecoder/JpegEncoderDecoder.cs#2)] [!code-cpp[jpegbitmapdecoderencoder#3](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/jpegencoderdecoder/jpegencoderdecoder.cpp#3)] [!code-vb[jpegbitmapdecoderencoder#3](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/JpegEncoderDecoder/JpegEncoderDecoder.vb#3)] [!code-cs[jpegbitmapdecoderencoder#3](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/JpegEncoderDecoder/JpegEncoderDecoder.cs#3)]
